lead_paragraph: Some competitors at the Rio Games have a real problem with the changes made to the event’s official ball and with the brand that was chosen.

headline.print_headline: A Rio Lament: That’s the Way the Ball Crumples
headline.main: A Rio Table Tennis Lament: That’s the Way the Ball Crumples

snippet: Some competitors at the Rio Games have a real problem with the changes made to the event’s official ball and with the brand that was chosen....
abstract: Some table tennis players are still struggling to adjust to new material of official ball, which switched from celluloid to different type of plastic after 2012 Olympics, and are angry with brand that was chosen for Rio Games; many players say quality of balls from DHS, Chinese equipment manufacturer, is inferior to those used in other international tournaments.
